intro: Idianthes, commonly known as the Indian thornapple, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to regions of southern and eastern Asia, including India and Southeast Asia. The plants typically feature showy, tubular flowers that are often red or orange in color, attracting various pollinators. They have succulent stems and leaves, which help them retain water in arid environments. Some species of Idianthes are cultivated for their ornamental value due to their striking floral display.
